page.title: 10Agriculture
page.content: Ground use outside the villages is almost all{arable farming}with a few grass paddocks.Main crops are potatoes and sugar beet plus barley and wheat. Some peas are grown for drying.In very recent years{oil seed rape}has become common with its distinctive yellow flowers and smell.Few,if any,carrots or cabbages are grown.Government and{ {E.E.C.}controls and{pricing support} influence the cropping pattern.With modern machinery farms need few workers even for 400-500 acres.The soils vary from{light sandy}to{heavy {loam}and some{clay.}Resevoirs have been dug by 3 farms.These can supply rain guns covering up to 300 acres. They cover an area of 6 acres and hold 14 million gallons of water.One is stocked with course fish and is leased by an angling club,another is stocked with trout (can be fished for a fee).
